content:
# I have successfully harvested 25 iron ore, and my inventory now contains:
# - 12 wood
# - 25 iron ore
# - 3 copper plates
# - 14 copper cables
# - 5 iron gear wheels

# Now, I need to smelt the iron ore into iron plates. 
# I will use the existing stone furnace to smelt the iron ore.

# First, I will insert coal into the furnace if it needs more fuel.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)  # Inserting coal into the furnace

# Next, I will insert the iron ore into the furnace for smelting.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=needed_plates * 5)  # Inserting enough iron ore to produce the required plates

print(f'Inserted coal and iron ore into the furnace at position {furnace_position}.')  # Confirming the action

# Now, I need to wait for the iron ore to smelt into iron plates.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time of 30 seconds
    if inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 5:  # Check if we have produced at least 5 iron plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # If it doesn't complete, raise an exception

# Finally, I'll check the inventory after the wait period to see if the iron plates have been produced.
print(f"Inventory after smelting: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Final check after iron smelting
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Confirming the status of the furnace and any other entities present
